definition: posting on a bulletin board/notice/bulletin/to announce
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.chinese: 瀏覽網上自由譯者佈告欄。

sentences.english: There was a notice in the supermarket.
Put the calories up on the board, just so people know.
sentences.chinese: 把熱量寫在佈告牌上，讓人們知道。

sentences.english: On our library door are two big signs.
sentences.chinese: 我們圖書館門上有兩張佈告。

sentences.english: A copy of the letter was posted on the noticeboard .
sentences.chinese: 佈告牌上張貼了這封信的內容。

sentences.english: She posted an advertisement seeking a house on the housing estate's bulletin board.
sentences.chinese: 她在小區的佈告欄裏貼出了求售房屋的廣告。

sentences.english: The teacher pegged a notice to a notice board.
sentences.chinese: 老師把通知釘在佈告欄上。

sentences.english: Angry workers tore the notice down from the noticeboard.
sentences.chinese: 憤怒的工人把佈告欄上的通告撕了下來。

sentences.english: There's a notice on the board saying that the meeting has been cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 佈告板上的通告說會議已經取消了。

sentences.english: I went through the town hall, I saw many people standing in front of the bulletin board.
sentences.chinese: 我走過鎮公所的時候，看見許多人站在佈告牌前邊。

sentences.english: He pinned the notice to the board.
sentences.chinese: 他把通知釘在佈告牌上。

sentences.english: On the cafe notice board I should think.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲可以貼在咖啡館的佈告牌上。

sentences.english: Let me stick this notice on the board.
sentences.chinese: 讓我把這個通知貼在佈告板上。

sentences.english: Please look at the notice board every day.
A notice was placed by the river bank warning people to keep off the thin ice.
sentences.chinese: 河邊有一個佈告牌，警告人們不要在薄冰上行走。

definition: Nationalist government 1920s-1949 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
to issue/to proclaim/to enact (laws, decrees etc)
to impose martial law/to impose emergency measures
president (of a country)/same as 總統|总统
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
